title: Is it legal to print out a copy of a book from Project Gutenberg? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Almost certainly. If something is in the public domain, it’s perfectly legal to print it out, to make thousands of copies, to create derivative works from it, etc. You’re not supposed to upload anything to Project Gutenberg unless it’s in the public domain. That said, I don’t know how they enforce that, so it’s possible that something on that website is really under copyright protection. For example, the novel Uncle Tom’s Cabin is in the public domain. But somebody could write an introduction to it that would still be under copyright protection. If the introduction and the original novel were uploaded to Project Gutenberg, I’d hope somebody would notice and remove the copyright-protected material. But if that didn’t happen, you could be sued for reproducing the copyright-protected material without permission.
Yes. All of the books in Project Gutenberg are in the Public Domain, which means you can do anything you want with them.
